source_sentence: 第六門第四子攝頌大藥之餘
translation: After the sixth entry, the fourth son prepares a verse on great medicinal herbs

source_sentence: 「是時大藥既知國事，將領四兵遍觀國界，每至城邑聚落問諸人言：『此等聚落誰所管耶？』
translation: "Now that Daya knew the affairs of the country, he led a group of four soldiers to look around the country's borders, and whenever he went to a town or village, he asked the people, 'Who's in charge of these villages?'

source_sentence: 諸人答曰：『此是某大臣、彼是某大臣，攝之屬己將為封邑。』
translation: The men answered, 'This is a certain minister, and that is a certain minister who takes it under his wing and will make it a feudal domain.'

source_sentence: 大藥聞知所有村城皆六大臣之所管攝，國主但唯內宮及飲食而已。
translation: Vairocana heard that all the villages and towns were under the control of the six ministers, but the lord of the kingdom had only the inner palace and food and drink.

source_sentence: 既遍觀已還白王曰：『何處城隍及以聚落是王所有？』
translation: After he had thoroughly examined them, he returned to the king and said, 'Where are the city gods and other towns that belong to the king?'

source_sentence: 王曰：『我今無力，知當奈何？
translation: The king said, 'Now that I have no power, what do I know?'

source_sentence: 幸蒙上天豫告於我：「滿財城內在圓滿家，當生一兒名曰大藥，既長成已立為大臣，端拱垂衣化洽黎庶。」
translation: It's fortunate that the gods have told me, "The Pūrṇa Vairocana family will give birth to a son named Daya, who will grow up to be a minister and carry his robe to the common people."

source_sentence: 為是因緣，汝從胎中我奉天命諸事供給。
translation: For this reason, I was commanded by Heaven to make offerings to you since you were born in the womb.

source_sentence: 今既成人親近於我，大臣之位汝今已得，宜可順彼天所記言，廣設智謨共宣國化，令我自在安隱為王。』
translation: Now that you've become an adult and are close to me, now that you've attained the position of minister, it would be appropriate for you to follow the gods' instructions and set out to teach the country with wisdom, so that I may be comfortable and secure as king.'

source_sentence: 是時大藥稽首致敬，白言：『大王！
translation: Medicine then paid homage by prostrating himself and saying, 'Great king!

source_sentence: 伏願無慮，我當助王令得安樂。』
translation: Please have no fear; I will help the king attain peace and happiness.'

source_sentence: 「大藥即便於自國界，所有城邑屬六臣者，令使告曰：『諸君當知！
translation: "Even though he was at his own border, Dāyāna sent an envoy to all the cities and towns belonging to the six ministers, telling them, 'You should know this, gentlemen!'

source_sentence: 比為大臣不遵國令，致使賦役辛苦非常，饕餮姦邪不相存濟。
translation: Perhaps a minister doesn't obey the state's orders, causing taxes to be extremely hard, and gourmands and adulterers don't help each other.

source_sentence: 我今以實相告，若用語者，長受安樂不復辛苦，所課賦稅隨力有無，眷屬妻子永無勞弊。
translation: Now, I tell you the truth, if you use words, you'll enjoy long-lasting comfort and no more hardship, be taxed according to your ability or lack thereof, and have your dependents and wives never suffer hardship.

source_sentence: 君等六城各自牢守，假令王命及六臣追，無宜用語；設其自至亦勿開門。
translation: You should guard each of the six cities individually, and even if the king's order and the six ministers pursue them, it's not advisable to use words; even if they arrive on their own, don't open the gate.

source_sentence: 報云：「大藥臣來我當賓伏。」』
translation: Their reply was, 'I will respectfully submit to the minister of medicine when he comes.'

source_sentence: 於其國內聞斯教已，並悉依行不遵舊令。
translation: After hearing this teaching, they all complied and didn't follow the old order.

source_sentence: 時彼諸臣共白王曰：『諸城反叛其欲如何？』
translation: The ministers then all said to the king, 'What do the cities want to do in rebellion?'

source_sentence: 王曰：『卿等可嚴四兵隨處討伐。』
translation: The king said, 'You may decorate four armies and go along with them to invade.'

source_sentence: 諸臣各至，彼不見隨，臣奏王曰：『我等無力，王可自來。』
translation: When the ministers arrived, they didn't see them follow, so they told the king, 'We're powerless; the king can come himself.'

source_sentence: 王即親行，彼亦不伏，徒勞戰陣淹滯多時。
translation: The king then went in person, but they didn't submit, so they labored in battle and were bogged down for a long time.

source_sentence: 諸城奏曰：『我於大王無心違背，六臣暴虐由是不隨。
translation: The cities reported, 'I have no intention of disobeying the king, but the six ministers' tyranny prevented them from following.

source_sentence: 若令大藥臣來，我皆降伏。』
translation: If we send the minister of medicine, we'll all be subdued.'

source_sentence: 王即令使往喚大藥，彼聞勅召馳至王所。
translation: The king then ordered his envoy to summon Daya, and when he heard the order, he rushed to the king's office.

source_sentence: 諸城百姓聞大藥至，皆悉無違開門令入，大藥即便削除虐政，更制輕科彝倫協敘，小大無怨，咸歌再造，共喜來蘇，賑貧窮、恤孤寡，猶如父母各生慈念。
translation: When the people of the city heard that Daya had arrived, they all opened their gates without disobedience and allowed him to enter. Even then, Daya removed the tyrannical government and made the rules less restrictive, so that family and friends could work together, the small and large had no complaints, and they all sang and reborn, rejoicing in the coming of the aid of the poor and orphans like a father and mother each showing kindness.

source_sentence: 國內人眾悉皆雲集，扈從大王俱至城所，聲聞隣國遠近稱揚。
translation: All the people of the country gathered together to escort the king to the city, and their reputation was known far and wide in the neighboring countries.

source_sentence: 王乃以女娉于大藥，雖蒙賞愛無驕恣心。
translation: The king then gave his daughter a contract with Daya, and although she was praised and loved, she didn't become proud of it.

source_sentence: 「時有異方貧士來投此王冀求榮祿，王不見許，復求大藥。
translation: "It was then that a poor man from another land came to the king seeking his prosperity, but the king didn't accept him and again sought Daya.

source_sentence: 大藥哀愍遂便招納，拯以衣食令無乏短。
translation: Being sympathetic, Daya accepted them, saving them with food and clothing so that they wouldn't be short of it.

source_sentence: 時有婆羅門來從大藥求索糠麥，即便遣與。
translation: A Brāhmaṇa then came from Daya seeking chaff and wheat, and he even sent it to them.

source_sentence: 時掌庫者苟事遷延，不即持惠。
translation: The treasurer then took his time and didn't immediately accept the offer.

source_sentence: 後於異時王與大臣及諸寮庶朝集一處，王告眾曰：『私密之事，誰可告知？』
translation: At some point later, the king and his ministers and servants gathered at a place in the courtyard, and the king told the crowd, 'Who can tell us about private matters?'

source_sentence: 有云：『密事應語知識。』
translation: There's the saying, 'A friend who answers questions about esoteric matters.'

source_sentence: 有云：『父母。』
translation: It's called, 'Parents.'

source_sentence: 有云：『妻子。』
translation: There's something that says, 'Wife.'

source_sentence: 然大藥默無所說，王曰：『大藥！
translation: Still, Daya said nothing, and the king said, 'Daya!'

source_sentence: 卿何不言？』
translation: Why don't you say so?'

source_sentence: 答曰：『言何容易？
translation: He replied, 'How easy is it to say?'

source_sentence: 如我所見，凡隱密事不可告語一切男子，況復女人！』
translation: As I have seen, you mustn't tell any man about anything that's hidden, much less a woman!'

source_sentence: 王曰：『豈並如此？』
translation: The king said, 'Is it not so?'

source_sentence: 大藥曰：『此之虛實，王當目驗。』
translation: Daya said, 'The king will examine this for himself, whether it's true or not.'

source_sentence: 後時王家失孔雀鳥，大藥捉得別處藏舉，將餘孔雀對婦前殺，報云：『汝豈不聞王失孔雀？』
translation: When the peacock was lost in the king's household, Daya captured it and hid it elsewhere. He killed the other peacock in front of the woman and reported, 'Didn't you hear that the king lost the peacock?'

source_sentence: 答曰：『我聞。』
translation: He replied, 'I've heard about it.'

source_sentence: 大藥曰：『此鳥即是，可疾料理，我欲充食，不得向人共論此事。』
translation: Daya said, 'This is the bird, and it can be cooked quickly. I want to fill it up with food, so I can't discuss this with anyone.'

source_sentence: 婦聞便念：『我父於此委寄非常，今者如何殺鳥而食？
translation: Hearing this, the woman then thought, 'My father entrusted me with this very thing; how could I kill a bird and eat it now?'

source_sentence: 誠哉鄙事無懼憲章。』
translation: 'It's true that I have no fear of a charter for my affairs.'

source_sentence: 又將餘女顏容美麗，以妙莊飾引入宅中，報其婦曰：『此之少女是王宮人，我愛將來，勿傳斯事。』
translation: He also brought the other girls into his house with beautiful faces and marvelous adornments and told the woman, 'This young woman is from the king's palace; I'll love her in the future; don't tell her such things.'

source_sentence: 婦聞此語深生忿怒：『我父如何不審思察，任用仄陋無宗族人，補為大臣委以國事，豈以王宮內人將充己室，所愛好鳥殺以為羹？』
translation: When she heard this, she became deeply angry, saying, 'How could my father not have thoughtfully appointed an ugly, clansmanless man to be a minister entrusted with the affairs of state?

source_sentence: 又復外國客人共相收納，供給衣食養為義士，婦以此事具白王知：『父於其人深相委寄，我觀惡行實無以加，今可令其退歸田里。』
translation: Another foreign guest took them in together, offering them clothing and food to support them as righteous men. The woman told the king about this, 'My father has deeply entrusted this man with his life, and I've observed that his bad deeds are really beyond compare; now I can make him retire to his farm.'

source_sentence: 王聞此語情生異見，遂令魁膾將大藥去准法刑戮。
translation: Hearing this, the king had a different view, so he ordered the captain to take Daya and execute him according to the law.

source_sentence: 時旃荼羅以赤穟花繫於頸下，打惡聲鼓惡人隨逐，舉刀怖懼如炎魔卒送向尸林。
translation: The Cāṇḍāla then tied a red-brown flower under his neck, beat a drum with bad noises, and was followed by bad men who held up swords in fear as fiery demons and guards were led to the cemetery.

source_sentence: 臨將就刑無人肯殺，觀者悲泣愛若己親，各出哀言為求天佛。
translation: When they were about to be executed, no one was willing to kill them, and those who watched them wept and loved them as if they were their own relatives, each speaking out in sympathy and begging for the Buddha of heaven.

source_sentence: 時外國客給衣食者，報諸人曰：『我能殺此。』
translation: The foreign visitor who gave them food and clothing then told them, 'I can kill this.'

source_sentence: 將出城時，彼婆羅門執大藥衣裾，從索糠麥一升。
translation: As he was leaving the city, that Brāhmaṇa took the train of Daya's robe and asked for a liter of chaff and wheat.

source_sentence: 是時大藥見此事已而說頌曰：「『國王不可親，　　惡人難附近；　　但是隱密事，　　不語婦人知。
translation: After he saw this, Dānavat spoke a verse, saying, 'The king is unkind, and it's hard for bad people to get close to him.

source_sentence: 我不食生鳥，　　不詃內宮人，　　不憶作欺心，　　負他糠麥債。』
translation: I won't eat live birds, I won't treat people in the palace, I won't think about deception, and I'll accept a debt of chaff from another.'

source_sentence: 「是時大藥欲就刑時作如是語，使者聞已謂大藥曰：『汝智過人作無義語。』
translation: "When Bhaiṣajyaguru was about to face punishment, the messenger heard this and said to Bhaiṣajyaguru, 'Your wisdom is superior to that of a person who makes pointless statements.'

source_sentence: 答曰：『此無義語非汝所解，可將我語至大王處。』
translation: He replied, 'This is a meaningless statement that you don't understand; take my words to the great king.'

source_sentence: 使以此語往白王知，王雖聽言亦未能了，遂令使往喚大藥來，問曰：『言何無義？』
translation: The messenger went to the king and told him this, but even though he heard what he said, he didn't understand it. He then sent the messenger to summon Daya and asked, 'What was the pointlessness of the words?'

source_sentence: 答曰：『語深有理。』
translation: He answered, 'That's a profound statement.'

source_sentence: 王曰：『其事如何？』
translation: The king said, 'What's the matter?'

source_sentence: 大藥白言：『願王善聽，略陳頌意。
translation: Daya said, 'May the king listen well as I summarize the meaning of this verse.

source_sentence: 所言國王不可親者，王先國中所有城邑並不臣屬，但唯飲食內宮而已，我運籌策壓彼強臣，寧國安家咸令復業，皇基熾盛率士歡謠，庫藏豐盈皆是我力；今欲殺我將報昔恩，故云國王不可親也。
translation: The king said the king is unkind because in his previous kingdom there were no subordinates in his town, except for food and drink at the inner palace. I used planning and strategy to suppress those powerful ministers, pacify the country, make families comfortable, and restore their businesses, make the royal family flourish, make people rejoice, and make the treasury abundant all because of my strength.

source_sentence: 言惡人難附近者，昔有貧人他鄉遊客，來投王處乞求活命，王不見納遂至我邊，我見貧寒，給以衣食得存性命；不思恩分，今來殺我。
translation: They say it's hard for a bad person to get close to them. In the past, a poor man visiting a foreign land came to the king begging for his life, but the king didn't accept him, so he came to me.

source_sentence: 言隱密事不語婦人者，王昔因朝告諸人曰：「若有密事誰可告知？」
translation: He said he wouldn't tell the woman about hidden matters. In the past, the king told the people in the morning, "If there are hidden matters, who can tell them?"

source_sentence: 有云：「父母妻子等。」
translation: It's said, "Parents, wives, and so forth."

source_sentence: 廣說如前。
translation: They're explained in detail as before.

source_sentence: 我云：「皆不可親，當審觀察王當目驗。」
translation: I say, 'None of them should be intimate; examine them carefully, and the king will examine them visually.'"

source_sentence: 王家孔雀我實不食，別將餘鳥令婦煮羹；王宮內人我無交涉，宮人瓔珞權假將來，暫借餘女居我宅內。
translation: I really won't eat the king's peacock, so I'll make the other birds into soup for the wife; I have no dealings with the people in the king's palace, so I'll borrow another woman to live in my house for a while, using the palace's jewels as a pretence.

source_sentence: 若不信者可喚將來。』
translation: If you don't believe me, you can call them to come.'

source_sentence: 王喚宮人，對觀無異。
translation: The king summons the palace staff, and they look at each other no differently.

source_sentence: 『言不負他糠麥者，王令魁膾將殺於我，其人遂至急捉衣裾，口云：「還我一升糠麥。」
translation: 'He said he wouldn't be responsible for the chaff, but the king ordered Kui to kill me, so he hurriedly grabbed him by the train and said, 'Give me back a liter of chaff.'

source_sentence: 意道無悲不知機變，昔時乞麥見死來徵。』
translation: The Way of the Mind has no compassion and doesn't know about miracles, and in the past he begged for wheat and saw death coming as a sign.'

source_sentence: 王聞頌義察其事已，知大藥無過歡喜釋放，便備盛禮拜為重臣。
translation: After the king heard the meaning of the verse and examined his actions, he knew that Daya was without error delighted and released, so he prepared a large salute and venerated him as an important minister.

source_sentence: 是時大藥稽首白王曰：『觀諸女人可共密言不？
translation: Dānavat then bowed his head and said to the king, 'Can you observe the women and tell them in confidence?'

source_sentence: 所賜女者於我無用，請即收取。
translation: 'The woman I've given you is useless to me, so please take her now.

source_sentence: 我今自訪言行德義氏族相當，聰慧女人以充家室。』
translation: Now, I myself will seek out a clan whose speech and conduct are both virtuous and worthy, and a wise woman to fill my household.'

source_sentence: 即辭王去作婆羅門像，手執淨瓶掛吉祥線，身著鹿皮面塗三畫，往本城中欲求其婦。
translation: He left the king and created an image of Brāhmaṇa, holding a pure vase in his hand and hanging an auspicious thread, wearing deerskin and wearing three pictures on his face, and went to his native city to ask for his wife.

source_sentence: 「路中日暮見婆羅門，彼便相問：『仁從何來？』
translation: "When he saw the Brāhmaṇa at sunset on the road, he asked him, 'Where did you come from, dear?'

source_sentence: 大藥答曰：『我從鞞提醯城來。』
translation: Mahāyāna answered, 'I've come from Vedisagiri.'

source_sentence: 『欲向何處？』
translation: 'Where do I want to go?'

source_sentence: 答曰：『向滿財城。』
translation: He answered, 'I'm headed for the city of Pūrṇa.'

source_sentence: 問曰：『汝於此處頗有相識欲投宿耶？』
translation: He asked, 'Do you have any acquaintances here who want to stay overnight?'

source_sentence: 答曰：『先無。』
translation: He replied, 'Not yet.'

source_sentence: 便將歸舍如法安置。
translation: He then returned to his abode and placed it according to the rules.

source_sentence: 大藥見彼婆羅門婦，知非貞素，既經宿已旦便欲去。
translation: When Daya saw that Brāhmaṇa's wife, he knew she wasn't a true vegetarian and wanted to leave after he had spent the night there.

source_sentence: 婆羅門曰：『我此貧居即是君宅，往來停宿幸不為疑。』
translation: The Brāhmaṇa said, 'This poor house of mine is your house; please don't be suspicious when you stop by for a night.'

source_sentence: 大藥便許，執手而別。
translation: Daya then gave his permission, held hands, and said goodbye.

source_sentence: 遂於前路於麥田中，見有少女，儀容端正似出良家，便生愛念問言：『賢首！
translation: Then, on the road ahead, he saw a young woman in a wheat field with the appearance of someone from a good family, and he thought fondly of her and asked, 'Good man!

source_sentence: 汝名字何？』
translation: What's your name?'

source_sentence: 答曰：『我名毘舍佉。』
translation: He answered, 'My name is Visākhā.'

source_sentence: 『誰家少女？』
translation: 'Whose maiden is it?'

source_sentence: 答曰：『聚落中尊是我之父。』
translation: He answered, 'The venerable one in the village is my father.'

source_sentence: 大藥念曰：『雖有容儀未識其智，今可試之。』
translation: Vaiśālī thought, 'Although I have the appearance and manner, I've never known his wisdom. Now I can test it.'

source_sentence: 大藥即往刈麥田中，高舉兩手以脚蹂麥，毘舍佉曰：『已知護手，足亦宜然。』
translation: He went out into the wheat field, raised his hands, and raked the wheat with his feet. Vaiśākha said, 'If you've known how to guard your hands, you should do the same with your feet.'

source_sentence: 大藥念曰：『此女有智。』
translation: Vaiśākha thought, 'This woman has wisdom.'

source_sentence: 即便告曰：『少女耳璫可愛光彩異常。』
translation: He then told her, 'The young woman's ears are lovely and unusually brilliant.'

source_sentence: 答曰：『為蓋臭身，有何好處？』
translation: He replied, 'What good would it do to cover up a smelly body?'

source_sentence: 又曰：『甚好容貌！』
translation: He also said, 'Very good-looking!'

source_sentence: 答曰：『父母所生，非關容飾。』
translation: He answered, 'Born from parents, it's not about appearance.'

source_sentence: 問曰：『父何處去？』
translation: He asked, 'Where's the father going?'

source_sentence: 答曰：『一身兩事。』
translation: He answered, 'One person and two things.'

source_sentence: 問曰：『此言何義？』
translation: He asked, 'What does this mean?'

source_sentence: 答曰：『身行取棘，斷其舊道，更通新路。』
translation: He answered, 'He walks around picking up thorns, cutting off old paths and making new ones.'

source_sentence: 『母在何處？』
translation: 'Where's Mother?'

source_sentence: 答曰：『歸家取種，欲植晚田。』
translation: He answered, 'I'll go home and get the seeds, and I want to plant a field for the evening.'

source_sentence: 問曰：『汝能與我為妻室不？』
translation: He asked, 'Will you take me as your wife and wife's wife?'

source_sentence: 答曰：『此由父母，非我所知。』
translation: He answered, 'This is from my parents, not from my knowledge.'

source_sentence: 問曰：『向滿財城路在何處？
translation: He asked, 'Where's the road to Pūrva-Videha?'

source_sentence: 平直柔軟復無棘刺，汝應指示令我安行。』
translation: Flat and straight, flexible, and without thorns, you should show me the way so that I can walk safely.'

source_sentence: 女指曲路。
translation: The woman pointed out the crooked path.

source_sentence: 即自前行，往至池邊變衣而坐，眇其一目，試彼大藥識知我不？

source_sentence: 「時有南國商人，將栴檀杖來至王所，兩頭相似本末難知，問毘舍佉，同前譏笑：『可將此杖置池水中，本即下沈、末便上出。』
translation: "Then, a merchant from a southern country brought a sandalwood staff to the king's office, and when he asked Vaiśākha about it, he laughed in agreement with the previous comment, 'You can put this staff in a pool of water, and the original will sink, and the derivative will rise.'

source_sentence: 試果如言，人皆歎美。
translation: When he did, everyone admired it.

source_sentence: 王作是念：『我今且欲試諸大臣誰最有智？』
translation: The king then thought, 'Now, I'd like to test which of my ministers has the most wisdom?'

source_sentence: 即於樓上更竪幢竿，竿頭安置光明寶珠，日光輝照影落池內，與珠不別。
translation: He then raised a banner pole on top of the tower and placed a bright, precious pearl at the pole's head, and the sun shone brightly, shining brightly, and the shadow fell into the pond, not distinguishing it from the pearl.

source_sentence: 告諸人曰：『若入池中，得此珠者我當賜與。』
translation: He told the people, 'If you go into the pond and get this pearl, I'll give it to you.'

source_sentence: 人皆入池求不能得。
translation: Everyone went into the pond looking for it, but they couldn't get it.

source_sentence: 大藥還報毘舍佉，彼便答曰：『可向上望尋得珠本。』
translation: Mahāyāna returned to Vaiśākha, who then replied, 'You can look up and find the pearl itself.'

source_sentence: 隨言而取，王曰：『是誰上智？』
translation: Taking it as he said, the king said, 'Who is the supreme intellect?'

source_sentence: 答曰：『是毘舍佉。』
translation: He replied, 'It's Vaiśākha.'

source_sentence: 王乃與珠，彌更稱善。
translation: The king then gave the pearl to Maitreya, who praised it as good.

source_sentence: 「時諸大臣見毘舍佉儀容挺特舉世無雙，皆悉有心共為私愛，以妙珠寶通使往還。
translation: "When the ministers saw how Vaiśākha's appearance was extraordinary and unsurpassed in the world, they all had the desire to share their affection for him and sent him back with a wonderful jewel.

source_sentence: 然毘舍佉曾無異念，見求不已，告大藥曰：『於君國境有如斯事，見他好婦遂即私求，深誠鄙惡。』
translation: However, Vaiśākha, who had never had any different thoughts, didn't stop looking for them and told Daya, 'Such a thing exists in your country, and to see another beautiful woman and then ask for her privately is truly despicable.'

source_sentence: 答曰：『此是世法人皆共傳，然彼婦女是貞確者即不隨從。』
translation: He replied, 'This is a common tradition among people in the world, but that woman is faithful and correct, so she won't follow it.'

source_sentence: 婦曰：『我欲辱彼，勿當見責。』
translation: The woman said, 'I want to humiliate her, so don't criticize me.'

source_sentence: 答曰：『隨意。』
translation: She replied, 'As you wish.'

source_sentence: 婦曰：『君可稱病，我自知時。』
translation: The woman said, 'You may claim to be ill; I'll know when I'm ill.'

source_sentence: 大藥如言，辭之以疾，諸臣遣使問毘舍佉，報云：『夫患，我意無違。』
translation: When he told her he was ill, the ministers sent an envoy to ask Vaiśākha about it, and he replied, 'My husband's illness is not contrary to my wishes.'

source_sentence: 即造木人形同大藥，臥在床席覆以薄衣。
translation: He then made a wooden figure in the shape of Daya, and he lay down on a bed and seat covered with thin clothing.

source_sentence: 報諸人云：『我夫病困形命無幾，可隨自力與我相親，勿令人見。』
translation: He told the others, 'My husband is ill and his life is limited; please follow your own strength and be close to me; don't let anyone see him.'

source_sentence: 遂即造六大櫃安六房中，大臣來者報云：『且藏此處恐有人知。』
translation: He then built six large cabinets and placed them in six rooms. The minister's visitor reported, 'Let's hide them here for fear that someone will know about them.'

source_sentence: 待入中已即牢鎖閑，如是六臣咸入於櫃。
translation: After he entered them, he locked them up securely and put them in the chests like this.

source_sentence: 告諸人曰：『大藥已亡。』
translation: They told the others, 'The great medicine has died.'

source_sentence: 王及諸臣中宮寮庶咸作是念：『如是勝人一朝殞歿。』
translation: The king and his ministers, the midshipmen, and the servants all thought, 'Such a remarkable man will die one day.'

source_sentence: 各生憂苦號哭失聲。
translation: Each of them became sad and distressed, and they lost their voices as they cried out.

source_sentence: 時毘舍佉便舁六櫃，來至王所白言：『大王！
translation: Vaiśākha then took the six chests and brought them to the king, saying, 'Great king!

source_sentence: 大藥身死，所有珍貨咸在櫃內，宜親領受。』
translation: After his death, he placed all of his valuables in the chest, so it's appropriate for him to accept them in person.'

source_sentence: 并說二頌。
translation: He also spoke two verses.

source_sentence: 王見悲慘，今日身亡便將物至。
translation: The king was saddened by this realization, for today he's going to bring his things after his death.

source_sentence: 于時大藥從側門入，花纓飾體來詣王前，含笑而白王言：『於我愛念極深，纔死不停，即收貲貨。』
translation: Then Daya entered through a side door, adorned with flowers and robes, and came to the king, smiling, and said to him, 'My longing for you is so deep that you didn't stop short of death and then you collected your valuables.'

source_sentence: 王曰：『非我索財，是毘舍佉身自持至，作如是語：「『大王今當知！
translation: The king said, 'I didn't ask for the money; it was Vaiśākha himself who brought it to him and said, 'Now, great king, you must know!

source_sentence: 大藥身已謝，　　此是彼珍寶，　　聞櫃可親觀。
translation: 'The body of the great healing herb has died, and this is his precious jewel, which I can personally examine on hearing the cabinet.

source_sentence: 我夫形影沒，　　孤寡無依附；　　恐有外人欺，　　失此王家物。』
translation: My husband's form is gone, and he's orphaned and has no support; I'm afraid outsiders will deceive him and he'll lose this treasure from the king's household.'

source_sentence: 「大藥曰：『若爾，王可開看，何物珍寶。』
translation: "Daya said, 'If that's the case, the king can open it and see what treasures are here.'

source_sentence: 既開櫃已，時六大臣各從中出。
translation: After opening the chest, the six ministers each emerged from it.

source_sentence: 王問其故，六臣答曰：「『我等由情欲，　　遂被女人欺；　　願乞大王恩，　　不敢更如是。』
translation: The king asked why, and the six ministers replied, 'We were deceived by a woman because of our passions; may I beg the king's kindness, for I dare not do that again.'

source_sentence: 「王曰：『世間輪轉皆由色欲，既遭此辱合受重愆。
translation: "The king said, 'The transmigration of the world is caused by sexual desire, and since we've been humiliated like this, we'll be severely wronged.

source_sentence: 卿等且歸，後別量度。』
translation: Please go back and be measured separately later.'

source_sentence: 王乃歎曰：『嗚呼女人！
translation: The king then praised them, saying, 'Aah! Women!

source_sentence: 能有如是貞素殊操，計策超倫昔未曾有，大臣輔相被辱至斯，因此便能制耽欲者。』
translation: To have such an outstanding conduct of modesty and simplicity is a stratagem unprecedented in the past, and the minister and his aides have been insulted up to this point, which makes it possible to restrain those who are addicted to desire.'

source_sentence: 王既慶悅，於毘舍佉倍加封祿，諸國普聞。
translation: When the king was pleased, he doubled Vaiśākha's rank and pay, and the kingdoms heard about it.

source_sentence: 「是時大王作如是念：『大藥有福，感得如是智慧之妻。』
translation: "The king then had this thought, 'Good for Daya, to have obtained such a wise wife.'

source_sentence: 便告大藥曰：『汝當為我求一夫人具才智者，能令內外國政安寧，我唯端拱安樂而住。』
translation: He then told Daya, 'You must find me a wife of great ability and wisdom who will bring peace to both the internal and external governments, and I'll simply live in well-being.'

source_sentence: 大藥對曰：『何處可求？』
translation: Daya replied, 'Where can I find one?'

source_sentence: 王曰：『我聞半遮羅國王有一女名曰妙藥，儀容絕代雅思超群，宜往求婚理亦應得。』
translation: The king said, 'I've heard that the king of Pancala has a woman named Medicine, whose appearance is superb and whose grace and intelligence are exceptional; it would be appropriate to go and propose marriage to her.'

source_sentence: 大藥答曰：『彼是鄰國，事若怨讎，先以方便，然後求及。』
translation: Daya replied, 'That's a neighboring country, and I think it's a matter of enmity; first, I'll ask for her with skillful means.'

source_sentence: 王令輔相自往言婚，時彼王臣見使到已，便共議曰：『鞞提醯王多有兵力，共交婚者情事相親；彼若自來，吉凶之事隨意當作。』
translation: When the king told his aides to go themselves and propose marriage, the king's ministers saw the arrival of the envoy and agreed, 'King Vaidehī has many soldiers, and those who marry together are close in affection; if they come themselves, they'll do as they like with good and bad fortune.'

source_sentence: 如是議已，即便許諾，卜選良晨，可於某日，宜來就此共作婚姻。
translation: After this discussion, they even promised to choose a good day when it would be appropriate to come and make a marriage together.

source_sentence: 使還白王：『求得彼女，當於某日期以禮成。』
translation: The envoy also told the king, 'He asked for that woman, and she will be married on a certain day.'

source_sentence: 彼王至日，廣設珍饌，所有飲食皆和毒藥。
translation: On the day he arrived, the king prepared a large feast, and all the food and drink were mixed with poison.

source_sentence: 時半遮羅王令使報鞞提醯曰：『我已備辦，當可速來。』
translation: King Pancala then had his envoy tell Vaidehī, 'I've prepared it, so you can come quickly.'

source_sentence: 其使至已，大藥白王：『未可倉卒，當善量議。
translation: When his envoy arrived, Daya said to the king, 'Don't be hasty; you must think it over well.

source_sentence: 隣國為怨自古常事，每有諍陣難共相親。』
translation: It's been a common occurrence since ancient times for neighboring states to be at odds, and it's difficult to be close to each other whenever there's a dispute.'

source_sentence: 王曰：『與誰評論？』
translation: The king said, 'Who will we consult?'

source_sentence: 答言：『大王！
translation: He replied, 'Great king!

source_sentence: 願不為慮，我有鸚鵡名曰具相，有大智慧善識人情，使往彼城觀已還報。』
translation: 'May it not be a concern that I have a parrot named Possessing Characteristics, which has great wisdom and good understanding of human feelings, and that I will send it to that city to look at it and return the favor.'

source_sentence: 王言：『任意。』
translation: The king said, 'As you wish.'

source_sentence: 是時鸚鵡既受言已，翔鳴騫翥到彼城中，依于樹杪四顧觀察，誰可量議通信去來？
translation: After he was told this, the parrot soared and prowled to that city, looked around from the perch of a tree, and observed, "Who can say whether communication is coming or going?

source_sentence: 誰堪委付？
translation: Who can be entrusted with this?

source_sentence: 竟無一鳥共為籌度。
translation: There wasn't a single bird that shared his thoughts.

source_sentence: 遂入王宮，於竹林中見舍利鳥巢，即至巢邊共相慰問：『汝從何來？』
translation: They went into the palace and saw the nest of the Śāriputra bird in the bamboo grove, so they went to the nest and asked each other, 'Where did you come from?'

source_sentence: 具相答曰：『我從北方室利王處來，先是監園使者，以舍利為婦，年少容儀端正無比，恭勤智慧善解言詞，因暫出遊被鵄擒去，我為此故憂箭中心，隨處追求聯翩至此，我無儔匹願汝為妻。』
translation: Gosho answered, 'I've come from the northern king Śrī, who was first a messenger to the monastery and had Śāriputra as his wife. I'm a young man of peerless appearance, respectful, intelligent, and well-versed in speech.

source_sentence: 答曰：『我不曾聞亦所未見，鸚鵡之鳥以舍利為妻，但聞鸚鵡還將鸚鵡為婦。』
translation: He replied, 'I've never heard or seen a parrot take a Śāriputra as its wife, but I've only heard of parrots taking parrots back as wives.'

source_sentence: 是時具相更以種種方便言詞共相勸諭，而說頌言：「『我是北邊王，　　室利守園使；　　舍利為我婦，　　智慧有言詞。
translation: The auspicious man then encouraged them both with various skillful words and spoke the verse, saying, 'I am the king of the north, the guard of the Śrī Garden, and Śāriputra is my wife, intelligent and articulate.

source_sentence: 暫因遊戲出，　　遂被鵄將去；　　我緣求彼故，　　飄颻因至斯。』
translation: I was temporarily led away by play, and then I was attacked by an śrāvaka; it was because I sought him out that I wandered off to this place.'

source_sentence: 「舍利答曰：「『舍利鸚鵡妻，　　未曾聞是事；　　還將鸚鵡對，　　智者所共知。』
translation: "Śāriputra answered, 'Śāriputra the parrot's wife, I've never heard of such a thing; yet I turned the parrot toward her, and it's known by wise men.'

source_sentence: 「各說頌已，更復評論，得意相通便為妻室，既為交密情無間然。
translation: "After they each spoke their verse, they again commented on it, agreed to become wives and lodgers, and then became close friends without interruption.

source_sentence: 是時具相見彼王家，造作種種上妙餅食，色類眾多皆是希有，具相見已告舍利曰：『何意宮中營斯盛饌，我今頗得甞其味不？』
translation: When the possessor saw that the king's household had prepared a variety of excellent cakes and foods of rare variety, he said to Śāriputra, 'Why is there such a feast in the palace, and will I get to taste it now?'

source_sentence: 答曰：『雖有如是上妙餅食，悉皆安毒。』
translation: He answered, 'Even though there's such wonderful bread to eat, it's all poisonous.'

source_sentence: 問言：『何故？』
translation: He asked, 'Why is that?'

source_sentence: 答曰：『為鞞提醯王欲來成禮作斯飲食，然有密意害彼王軍。』
translation: They replied, 'King Vaidehī wanted to pay homage to him by preparing this meal, but there was a hidden intention to harm the king's army.'

source_sentence: 具相委問細察知已，而說頌曰：「『咸云此王女，　　娉與鞞提醯；　　雖有此傳聞，　　未知虛與實？』
translation: After Gosain asked about it and carefully investigated it, he spoke a verse, saying, 'They say this king's daughter was given this gift to Vaidehī; even though there's a rumor about it, don't they know whether it's real or not?'

source_sentence: 「舍利答曰：「『王不與彼女，　　愚者謾稱量；　　以此為方便，　　意欲行誅戮。』
translation: "Śāriputra answered, 'The king won't give her a woman, for a foolish man would misjudge her; for this reason, he intends to kill her.'

source_sentence: 「是時鸚鵡知此事已，如大商主得上奇珍，踊躍歡欣，告舍利曰：「『我今還北方，　　報室利國王；　　得好聰明婦，　　相似解言詞。』
translation: "When the parrot learned this, it was like a great merchant who has found a rare treasure and rises up in joy and rejoices, telling Śāriputra, 'Now, I've returned north to report to the king of Śrī; I've found a good and clever woman who understands words similarly.'

source_sentence: 「舍利答曰：「『聖子汝今去，　　見彼室利王；　　七宿早須還，　　無宜更遲晚。』
translation: "Śāriputra answered, 'Now, noble son, you've gone to see that king of Śrī; you must return seven nights earlier; there's no need to be late.'

source_sentence: 「是時鸚鵡飛上虛空，不久便至大藥之所，以事具告，大藥次第悉以白王，勸不須往。
translation: "The parrot then flew up into the sky and soon reached Daya and told him everything, and Daya told the king in turn that he didn't need to go.

source_sentence: 是時彼王知此不去，整四兵眾詣鞞提醯，四面圍合進退無從。
translation: Knowing that he wouldn't go, the king gathered his four armies and marched to Vaidehī, surrounded on all sides by them, and there was no way to advance or retreat.

source_sentence: 王與大藥共為謀計其欲如何？
translation: The king and Daya planned together what they wanted to do.

source_sentence: 大藥曰：『不可交兵，應為離間。』
translation: Daya said, 'We mustn't engage the troops; we should leave them.'

source_sentence: 時彼營內有五百大臣，皆以國家珍寶而重贈遺。
translation: At the time, there were five hundred ministers in his camp who gave him a generous gift of the nation's treasures.

source_sentence: 諸臣既得，咸生異念不隨王語。
translation: When the ministers had received them, they all had second thoughts and didn't follow the king's words.

source_sentence: 大藥與王作斯事已，令使報曰：『非我不能與君共戰，既為妻父即是密親，當善思量身存為本。
translation: After doing this deed with the king, Daya told his envoy to report, 'If it weren't for me, I wouldn't be able to fight with you.

source_sentence: 今至我所活不自由，若不信言當須親驗。
translation: Now, when I come to live, I'm not free; if you don't believe what I say, you must examine it yourself.

source_sentence: 我將某物與某大臣，其五百人皆受贈賜，可即搜問足了真虛。』
translation: I've given something to a certain minister, and five hundred of them have been given a gift; you may search for it and find out whether it's true or false.'

source_sentence: 彼即尋求悉皆是實，彼知事異中夜收軍，既至城已遂便總殺五百大臣，諸臣之子令繼父業。
translation: He then sought out all of them, knowing that they were real. He gathered his army in the middle of the night when he realized the difference, and when he reached the city, he summarily killed 500 ministers and made the sons of the ministers succeed their father.

source_sentence: 大藥白王：『事已如是，且無他難，我欲暫往求女為婚，得不未知須觀其意。』
translation: Daya said to the king, 'So it is, and there's no other difficulty; I'd like to go for a while to ask a woman to marry me, but I'll have to see if I don't know what she wants.'

source_sentence: 王曰：『隨去。』
translation: The king said, 'Go ahead.'

source_sentence: 大藥將兵往半遮羅國園中停止，彼王便喚可入城來。
translation: After he had sent his troops to stop at the garden of Panchala, the king then called out to him to let him enter the city.

source_sentence: 答曰：『我不入城，且宜向彼大臣家住。』
translation: He answered, 'I won't go into the city; I'd better go and stay at the minister's house.'

source_sentence: 王曰：『隨意。』
translation: The king said, 'As you wish.'

source_sentence: 時諸臣子共作是議：『殺我等父皆由大藥，既是怨讎不應輒放。』
translation: The ministers then said together, 'This is the great medicine that killed our father; since it's a grudge, it shouldn't be easily released.'

source_sentence: 臣白王曰：『鞞提醯王自無計策，興隆王業皆是大藥之功，由此不能有所侵掠，且留於此勿令四出，我將兵眾往破彼城。』
translation: The ministers said to the king, 'King Vaidehī has no strategy, and the prosperity of the king's business is due to the great medicine.

source_sentence: 王乃稱善，即領四兵至鞞提醯國圍遶其城。
translation: The king then said yes, and he led his four armies to Vaidehī to surround his city.

source_sentence: 于時大藥知半遮王從某道去向鞞提醯，大藥訪知彼王珍寶咸在某處，并女妙藥一處同居。
translation: Knowing that King Pancha was headed toward Vaidehī by a certain road, Daya visited the king and learned that his treasures were somewhere, and that he had a woman named Myōkaku living in the same place.

source_sentence: 大藥即便強入宮中，將女妙藥及諸珍寶，總率兵眾別路而歸。
translation: Even then, Vairocana forced himself into the palace, took the woman and her treasures, led his troops in a separate direction, and returned.

source_sentence: 既見王已，總集朝官慶喜無量。
translation: After he saw the king, he gathered the courtiers together and rejoiced incalculably.

source_sentence: 時半遮國使至奏王：『珍寶及女被他將去。』
translation: An envoy from Pancha then arrived to tell the king, 'The treasures and the woman were taken away by others.'

source_sentence: 王得信已爰命旋師。
translation: After the king was convinced, he ordered his troops to return.

source_sentence: 時此國王廣施大禮，婚媾已畢，即策妙藥為大夫人。
translation: The king of that country then paid a great deal of respect, and after the marriage was consummated, he made Myōha a great wife.

source_sentence: 時半遮王令使齎書與妙藥曰：『我懷憂悶汝豈不知，可細尋求誰傳此事，食和毒藥欲害彼王？』
translation: King Pancha then had his envoy bring a letter to Miaoye saying, 'I'm troubled. Don't you know that you can carefully search for someone who would convey this message and eat poisonous herbs with the intent to harm the king?'

source_sentence: 女得書已推察其事，知是大藥鸚鵡傳通密信，令使報父。
translation: When she got the writing, she inferred the matter and knew that it was a giant medicine parrot that had sent a secret message, which she ordered her messenger to report to her father.

translation: Even then, Udam explained to the king, 'My husband's parents gave him to me as a gift, and he has great wisdom and insight.

source_sentence: 王即以緣報大藥知，大藥曰：『願王勿憂，我令彼女於王愛重，其婆羅門身形鄙劣，夫人光彩超群不敢親附。』

source_sentence: 是時大藥報婆羅門曰：『仁來宮內欲何所求？』
translation: Then Daya reported to the brāhmaṇa, 'What do you want from her in the palace?'

source_sentence: 答曰：『我婦大王將入宮內。』
translation: He answered, 'My wife, the king, will enter the palace.'

translation: He asked, 'Do you know your wife?'

source_sentence: 答曰：『我識。』
translation: He answered, 'I know.'

translation: If they are mistaken, the sword will chop off your head.'

source_sentence: 彼言：『隨教。』
translation: He said, 'As you've been taught.'

source_sentence: 王勅宮人並皆莊飾來至我所，即皆總集如帝釋宮五百婇女，隨從烏曇皆詣王所。
translation: The king commanded the palace staff to come to me decorated, and they all assembled like the five hundred womens of Indra's palace and followed him to the king's palace in udumbara.

source_sentence: 大藥遂報婆羅門曰：『識汝妻不？』
translation: He then told the Brāhmaṇa, 'Do you know your wife?'

source_sentence: 惡相既見非常嚴飾，猶如龍蛇被呪所禁一無言說，又如赫日不敢目視。
translation: After seeing him very ornately decorated, the evil-looking man was like a dragon or snake that had been restrained by a spell, saying nothing, and like Heli who didn't dare to look at him.

source_sentence: 時婆羅門遙望而住，諸女皆過，有一從婢，形如餓鬼，在後而行，惡相捉之云：『是我婦。』
translation: When the Brāhmaṇa looked away and stayed, the women all passed by, and there was a servant girl, shaped like a hungry ghost, walking behind them, whom the evil spirit caught and said, 'That's my wife.'

source_sentence: 大藥曰：『若是汝婦，隨意將行。』
translation: Daya said, 'If she's your wife, go ahead and do as you like.'

source_sentence: 即便持取，而說頌曰：「『上人還愛上，　　中人自愛中；　　我是餓鬼形，　　還怜汝餓鬼。
translation: He then took her and spoke a verse, saying, 'The superior person still loves the superior, and the middling person loves the middling; I'm in the shape of a hungry ghost, so I'll take pity on you hungry ghosts.'

source_sentence: 棄此天宮處，　　相隨向鬼家；　　色類正相當，　　求餘不可得。』
translation: Abandoning this place in the palace of heaven, you followed it to the home of a ghost; your form is exactly the same, but you can't get anything else.'

source_sentence: 「復於異時，大藥因有少過，王意不平遂不與語。
translation: "Again, at another time, the king's intentions were not fair because of Daya's minor misdeeds, so he didn't speak to her.

source_sentence: 王與宮女向苑園中竟日遊戲，是時夫人脫頸真珠瓔珞價直百千兩金，掛樹枝上忘而不取，日暮言歸，睡至中宵然後方憶。
translation: The king and his palace maids spent several days playing in the garden. At the time, the lady took off her neck and hung a necklace made of genuine pearls and jewelry costing a hundred thousand taels of gold on a branch and forgot to take it.

source_sentence: 時彼真珠獼猴見之持上高樹，王令使去急可取珠，使去不獲。
translation: When that monkey with the real pearl saw it, it was carried up to a high tree, and the king ordered it to leave and hastily retrieve the pearl, but the monkey left and didn't get it.

source_sentence: 時有乞兒，拾殘食已將欲出園，使者遂執：『更無人入，還我珠瓔。』
translation: A beggar then was about to leave the garden after gathering scraps of food, so the messenger insisted, 'No one else will enter, so return my pearls and beads.'

source_sentence: 答曰：『我是乞人，不見瓔珞。』
translation: He replied, 'I'm a beggar, and I haven't seen a necklace.'

source_sentence: 即便打拷將付禁官。
translation: He was then beaten and tortured, and handed over to the constable.

source_sentence: 乞者自念：『我今應設方便，若更住此被餓而亡。』
translation: The beggar thought to himself, 'Now, I should make a way, for if I stay here any longer, I'll die of starvation.'

source_sentence: 告使者曰：『我得珠瓔，持與某甲長者之子。』
translation: He told the messenger, 'I found a pearl necklace and gave it to the son of an elder.'

source_sentence: 使者即便收長者子，同一木枋而械其足。
translation: The messenger then took the elder's son, placed him on the same wooden square, and restrained his feet.

source_sentence: 時長者子每至食時多持上味，乞人從覓，子乃吒曰：『汝為此故引我將來，不能與汝。』
translation: Whenever the son of the elder came to eat, he often took the best flavors and asked someone to find them.

source_sentence: 子既食罷欲去旋迴，答曰：『我時未至不能共去。』
translation: When he finished eating, he wanted to leave and turn around, but he replied, 'My time has not yet arrived, so I can't go with you.'

source_sentence: 彼便愛語告曰：『可共我行，令汝安樂。』
translation: He then lovingly told him, 'You can travel with me, so that you'll be comfortable.'

source_sentence: 報曰：『可為要誓，當隨汝言。』
translation: He replied, 'I can give you a vow, and I'll follow your words.'

source_sentence: 彼既設誓遂共旋行。
translation: Now that he has made a vow, he'll travel with them.

source_sentence: 子報家人曰：『明日已後常將兩人食來。』
translation: The son told the family, 'After tomorrow, I'll always bring food for two people.'

source_sentence: 乞人因此情生歡樂，作如是念：『我於昔時，遍行城郭尚不能得麁食充軀，今餐美味更何所少！
translation: The beggar was delighted by this and thought, 'In the past, I traveled all over the city and country but couldn't get enough crude food to fill my belly; how much less delicious food could I eat now!'

source_sentence: 然我不能獨身而臥。』
translation: I can't lie down by myself, though.'

source_sentence: 即引城中第一倡女：『此亦共我分瓔珞珠。』
translation: He then led the first woman in the city to share his necklace with him, 'This is also the woman who shared my necklace.'

source_sentence: 女既至已同處禁身，便與交歡得意而住。
translation: After she arrived, she was confined to the same place, and then she made merry with him and stayed there to his heart's content.

source_sentence: 乞人念曰：『設禁我身，滿十二年亦未求出，然於五欲尚未圓滿，美妙音聲終須悅耳。』
translation: The beggar thought, 'Suppose I've been confined to my body for 12 years and haven't sought release, but I haven't yet fulfilled the five desires, and I still need to please my ears with beautiful sounds.'

source_sentence: 復引樂人共取瓔珞，彼雖稱枉不免禁身，音樂隨情更無所乏，如是遷延遂經多月。
translation: He then led the musicians to collect the jewelry together, and although they claimed to be in error, they weren't spared the confinement, and the music went on as they liked for many months.

source_sentence: 諸人勞倦共告乞人曰：『汝放我等，令汝安樂。』
translation: The men, weary as they were, all told the beggar, 'Release us so that you may be comfortable.'

source_sentence: 乞人自念：『斯等既出，豈復相憂？
translation: The beggar thought to himself, 'Now that they've left, how could they be so worried?'

source_sentence: 如我思忖，自非大藥計策鑒明，能令我身免斯幽獄。』
translation: As I thought about it, it wasn't Daya's wise counsel that saved my body from this dark hell.'

source_sentence: 即引大藥之子亦共分珠。
translation: He then led Bhaiṣajyaguru's son to share the pearl with him.

source_sentence: 其子既禁，大藥便念：『我子被幽寧容閑住。』
translation: After his son was forbidden, Daya then thought, 'My son would be better off staying in a secluded place.'

source_sentence: 即入白王：『我雖有愆，子無過咎，因何我子輒復禁身？』
translation: He then went in and said to the king, 'Although I've been wrong, my son isn't wrong; why is my son so easily confined?'

source_sentence: 王曰：『百千兩金真珠瓔珞，乞人將去於外共分。』
translation: The king said, 'One hundred thousand taels of gold, real beads, and jewelry, and I'd like someone to share them with me when they leave.'

source_sentence: 具說所由以告大藥。
translation: He explained the reason and told him about it to Medicine.

source_sentence: 即白王曰：『願不須憂，此妙頸珠無人將去，以臣之計必望求得，其所繫人請皆放出。』
translation: He then said to the king, 'Please don't worry, for no one will leave this marvelous necklace or jewel, but I surely hope to find it because of my plan, so please release all those who are tied to it.'

source_sentence: 王令釋放。
translation: The king ordered them to be released.

source_sentence: 大藥入園檢失珠處，仰觀高樹見有獼猴，念：『彼珠瓔是此將去，然須方便始可得之。』
translation: When Daya went into the garden to examine the place where he had lost the pearl, he looked up at a tall tree and saw a monkey. He thought, 'That pearl and bead will soon be gone, but I'll need a way to get it.'

source_sentence: 即白王曰：『還可如前宮人並出，頸下瓔珞咸悉莊嚴。』
translation: He then said to the king, 'Can you still produce them like the people in the palace before, with all the jewelry under their necks adorned?'

source_sentence: 獼猴遙見，取珠掛頸。
translation: The monkey saw it from a distance and took the pearl and hung it around his neck.

source_sentence: 大藥曰：『宮人起舞。』
translation: Daya said, 'The palace people will dance.'

source_sentence: 猴見亦舞，大藥曰：『可並低頭。』
translation: When the monkeys saw it, they also danced, and Daya said, 'May I bow my head together?'

source_sentence: 猴亦低頭，珠便墮地。
translation: The monkeys also bowed their heads, and the pearl fell to the ground.

source_sentence: 王見大喜，嗟其奇智，捨罪策功，重增封祿。
translation: The king was overjoyed at his sight and praised his marvelous wisdom. He gave up his crimes and merits and was rehonored.

source_sentence: 「時彼六臣因聚一處，共為議曰：『我等昔時王俱愛重，分彊畫野並得安居，今日由斯貧賤下俚，數呈薄伎遂得當途，致令我等喪亡祿位，侵城奪邑知欲如何？』
translation: "The six ministers then gathered in one place and discussed it together, saying, 'In the past, we were all loved and respected by the king, and we were able to live in a peaceful environment while sharing the same territory.

source_sentence: 一臣告曰：『我等六人共為盟要，所有言契誓不相負，同心戮力杜絕怨讎，大藥及王於我無恨，可令祿位還復如先。』
translation: One of the ministers told him, 'The six of us have made a compact, vowing not to be at odds with each other, to work together to end enmity, and to have Daya and the king hold no grudge against me, so that our positions of honor may be restored as before.'

source_sentence: 如是議已，明日六臣共詣園所。
translation: After this discussion, the six ministers went together to the park on the morrow.

source_sentence: 大藥既見六臣一處同聚，必有非常之議，便告具相鸚鵡曰：『汝往園中觀彼聚集，作何籌議？
translation: Seeing that the six ministers were all gathered together in one place, Daya must have had some extraordinary discussions, so he told the well-appointed parrot, 'What do you think as you go out into the garden and watch them gather?'

source_sentence: 還來報我。』
translation: Come back to me!'

source_sentence: 鸚鵡即去，隱影林中聽彼言說。
translation: The parrot then departed and withdrew into the forest to listen to what they said.

source_sentence: 時彼六臣既至園中，各以男女共為婚對，作如是語：『既為親密無復猜疑，謀計之事勿令外洩，以實相告。』
translation: When the six ministers arrived in the garden, they each took a man and woman in marriage and said, 'Now that we're close, there's no more doubt; don't let your plans be revealed; tell the truth.'

source_sentence: 一云：『我先曾食王家孔雀。』
translation: One said, 'I once ate the king's peacock.'

source_sentence: 一云：『我與內人交通。』
translation: One said, 'I was in communication with an insider.'

source_sentence: 餘並各述己情共為謀事。
translation: The others each shared their own personal stories about what they were planning to do.

source_sentence: 如是六人更相告語，便共同盤一處而食。
translation: Thus, the six of them told each other again, and then they shared a common place to eat.

source_sentence: 鸚鵡聞已告大藥知，大藥入內具白王曰：『王之大臣如是忠素，伏惟思察事欲如何？』
translation: After the parrot heard this, it was brought to Daya's attention, and Daya went inside and told the king, 'The king's ministers are so loyal and vegetarian; please consider what you want them to do.'

source_sentence: 王具問知悉皆是實，即便擯斥驅逐邊方。」
translation: The king asked about them all and learned that they were real, so he even rebuked and expelled them to the other side."

source_sentence: 佛告諸苾芻：「汝等勿生異念，往時大藥者即我身是，中興王者舍利子是，彼六大臣者即六師是。
translation: The Buddha told the monks, "Don't get the wrong idea, for in the past, the great healer of medicines was me, the king who revived the world was Śāriputra, and those six ministers were the six teachers.

source_sentence: 我於昔日擯彼六臣，今為三界最尊現大神通，還驅六師外道。
translation: In the past, I expelled those six ministers, but now I'm the most honored one in the three realms who has shown great supernormal powers and has returned to expel the six non-Buddhist teachers.

source_sentence: 汝等苾芻於善知識應當親近，然由智識聰敏通明一切，內外典籍終能成就如是盛德，汝當修學。」
translation: You monks should get close to a good teacher, but because of your wisdom and intelligence, you'll understand them all, and you'll eventually attain such great virtue from internal and external texts, so you should train them."
